intro: Melicope incana, commonly known as the hairy melicope, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy bark and opposite, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by round, fleshy berries that are edible. Melicope incana is often found in coastal and lowland forest habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
